definitions.definition: A registry of pecuniary transactions; a written or printed statement of business dealings or debts and credits, and also of other things subjected to a reckoning or review.
A sum of money deposited at a bank and subject to withdrawal.
definitions.example: to keep one's account at the bank.

definitions.definition: A statement in general of reasons, causes, grounds, etc., explanatory of some event; a reason of an action to be done.
definitions.example: No satisfactory account has been given of these phenomena.

definitions.definition: A reason, grounds, consideration, motive; a person's sake.
definitions.example: Don't trouble yourself on my account.

definitions.definition: A business relationship involving the exchange of money and credit.
A record of events; recital of transactions; a relation or narrative; a report; a description.
An estimate or estimation; valuation; judgment.
An authorization to use a service.
definitions.example: I've opened an account with Wikipedia so that I can contribute and partake in the project.

definitions.definition: A reckoning; computation; calculation; enumeration; a record of some reckoning.
